title: 110_s3634
content:
The "End Gun Trafficking Act of 2008" prohibits multiple handgun sales or purchases. The "End Gun Trafficking Act of 2008" prohibits the sale or purchase of multiple handguns within a 30-day period for unlicensed individuals under section 923 of title 18, United States Code. Exceptions to the "End Gun Trafficking Act of 2008" include exchanging one handgun for another, transfers to government entities or law enforcement officers for official use, such as for law enforcement purposes on or off duty. The "End Gun Trafficking Act of 2008" allows exceptions for transferring or purchasing a handgun listed as a curio or relic by the Attorney General. Penalties under Section 924(a)(2) of title 18, United States Code, are amended to include violation of the Act. Conforming amendments in Chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, address changes in section 922(t) related to transfers of handguns. The Attorney General is authorized to issue rules and regulations to ensure the national instant criminal background check system can identify violations of section 922(aa) of title 18, United States Code. Multiple sales reporting requirement under section 923(g) is eliminated by striking paragraph (3). SEC. 3. INCREASED PENALTIES FOR FALSE STATEMENTS RELATED TO FIREARMS: Amends Section 924(a)(3) of title 18, United States Code to increase the penalty for knowingly false statements from "one year" to "5 years".

SEC. 4. RETENTION OF RECORDS. (a) Retention of Records.--Section 922(t)(2)(C) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to require retention of records for not less than 180 days after the transfer is allowed.
(b) Repeals.--Section 617 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2004 and Section 615 of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005 are amended to remove certain provisions. The text chunk discusses amendments made to various appropriations acts for fiscal years 2006 and 2008, specifically regarding the insertion of "for" and the removal of certain provisions. The text chunk discusses amending appropriations acts for fiscal years 2006 and 2008 by inserting a period. Section 921(a)(21)(C) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include any person who transfers more than 1 handgun in any 30-day period to a person who is not a licensed dealer.
